document.docAuthor: Nielsen, Jørgen G., Schwarzhans, Werner & Cohen, Daniel M.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Hastatobythites and Saccogaster (Teleostei, Bythitidae) with three new species and a new genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Hastatobythites and Saccogaster (Teleostei, Bythitidae) with three new species and a new genus

Hastatobythites
Machida 1997

, type species by original designation
Hastatobythites arafurensis
Machida, 1997
.
Hastatobythites :

.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Similarity.
Hastatobythites
is most similar to
Saccogaster
in having more or less prolonged pectoral radials, naked head, teeth on palatines and thin skin.
Hastatobythites
differs from
Saccogaster
by having one median spine on frontal plate ( vs. a pair or none), very narrow head ( 5.6 –6.0 % SL vs. 10.5 –15.0 % SL) and body ( 3.5–3.9 % SL vs. 4.2–9.5 % SL) and three median bony ridges behind frontal spine (absent or one in
Saccogaster
).
Hastatobythites
differs from
Parasaccogaster
n. gen. in the very narrow head, three median bony ridges behind frontal spine, prolonged free pectoral radials ( vs . adnate) and the thin, tight head skin ( vs. thick and loose).
